text: Victor Assis Brasil (August 28, 1945 – 1981) was a Brazilian jazz saxophonist. He was the brother of classical pianist João Carlos Assis Brasil. He studied at Berklee College of Music and later taught improvisation technique in Brazil. He also toured on three continents.Musica Brasiliera review of a tribute CD He is said to have been more popular outside Brazil than in it and his style was strongly influenced by non-Brazilian musicians. ==References== ==External links== *Assis Brasil site Category:Brazilian jazz musicians Category:Berklee College of Music alumni Category:1945 births Category:1981 deaths Category:Brazilian saxophonists Category:Male saxophonists Category:20th-century saxophonists Category:20th-century male musicians Category:Male jazz musicians
title: Victor Assis Brasil
